body_html:
@girving I thought if the graph doesn't use the first derivative in the forward pass the second derivative won't be computed in the backward pass since there will be no edges connecting it with anything anyone will run, as a consequence of how we prune graphs for feeds and fetches. Or am I missing something?

If I'm not missing anything, option (1) is a good way to go.

body:
@girving I thought if the graph doesn't use the first derivative in the forward pass the second derivative won't be computed in the backward pass since there will be no edges connecting it with anything anyone will run, as a consequence of how we prune graphs for feeds and fetches. Or am I missing something?

If I'm not missing anything, option (1) is a good way to go.
